b: ^ Hello there, strange archer... Welcome to my underground forest.
^ Boss! Here comes the inspector again!

Encounter1: ^Greetings, peculiar archer... Welcome to my underground forest.
^Impossible, how can this maze lead to a Dragon!
^Well, what's more normal for a dragon than to protect his Dungeon?
^A Dungeon? So the @@house@@ led to a Dungeon? Is this the end of this puzzle?
^Your @@house@@ would lead to my place? Haha! You're dreaming, archer.
^Then how? How can a door from the <color=blue>house</color> lead here?
Regen: ^You must have been the victim of a magical item... If your @@house@@ can lead to places you don't know, then perhaps it led you to this world?
^But I'm afraid that in this case, you can't go back.
^But then I'm stuck in this Dungeon? What will become of me... I must escape, survive, quickly!
Damages: ^Calm down, my friend. Think rationally, explore this dungeon, you'll surely find a way back home...
^Are you sure? You're right, if a door from the @@house@@ can lead here, then another one can surely take me back!
Encounter2: ^So, stranger, still looking for a way back to your @@house@@?
^This cursed forest again!? Will this dungeon finally give me a break?
^Come on, Mr. Navidson, you must realize that all of this is not personal. I'm just doing my job.
^But I never asked to be trapped here! I don't even want your treasure! I just want to go home!
Regen2: ^Listen, Navidson... However you were transported here, there must be a way to get back home.
^Your strange @@house@@ must be magical. There may be no way back if it was magic.
^But then I'm stuck in this Dungeon? What will become of me... I must escape, survive, quickly!
Damages2: ^Aren't you a great adventurer? You won't let this get you down, come on. Think of the glory when you're back!
^You're right! I'm the first human to set foot here! I'm going to be famous!
